intro: Xanthostemon ruber, commonly known as the red myrtle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a fragrant, resinous scent. Xanthostemon ruber is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
